documents.content:
# Clean Water State Revolving Fund (CWSRF) Guide (2026)

## What is CWSRF?

The [CWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/srf/) provides low-interest financing for water quality projects including wastewater treatment, stormwater management, water recycling, and nonpoint source pollution control.

## Eligible Applicants

- Government entities (cities, counties, districts)
- Tribes
- Nonprofit organizations
- **Note:** Private for-profit entities generally NOT eligible as primary recipients

## Eligible Project Types

### Wastewater (Most Common)
- Treatment plant upgrades
- Collection system improvements
- Sewer rehabilitation
- New treatment facilities

### Water Recycling
- Recycled water treatment
- Distribution systems
- Storage facilities

### Stormwater
- Green infrastructure
- Capture and reuse
- Treatment BMPs
- Flood control with water quality benefits

### Nonpoint Source
- Agricultural runoff control
- Urban runoff reduction
- Habitat restoration

### Estuary Projects
- Coastal water quality
- Wetland restoration
- Habitat protection

## Financial Terms

### Interest Rate
- Half of California's average GO bond rate
- ~1.9% - 2.3% typically
- Well below commercial rates

### Loan Terms
- Standard: 30 years
- Matches infrastructure useful life

### Principal Forgiveness

**For Small DAC/SDAC:**
- Through Office of Sustainable Water Solutions
- Can cover substantial project costs

**For Water Recycling/Stormwater:**
- Specific allocations available
- Public health or supply resilience benefits required

## FY 2025-26 Funding Availability

| Category | Amount |
|----------|--------|
| Total Fundable List | ~$2.8 billion |
| CWSRF Loans Available | ~$1.1 billion |
| Principal Forgiveness | ~$514 million |
| Water Recycling Grants | ~$161.9 million |
| Planning Grants | ~$18.6 million |

### Fundable List Cut-off
- **Score required:** 12 or higher
- Projects scored on water quality benefits, DAC status, project readiness

## Application Process

### Step 1: Review Intended Use Plan
- Current year funding priorities in the [CWSRF Intended Use Plan (PDF)](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/srf/docs/2025/cwsrf-iup-sfy2025-26-final.pdf)
- Eligible project types
- Scoring criteria

### Step 2: Submit Through FAAST
- [FAAST Portal](https://faast.waterboards.ca.gov)
- Technical documentation
- Financial information
- Environmental compliance

### Step 3: Priority Scoring
- Water quality benefits
- Affordability/DAC status
- Project readiness
- Climate adaptation

### Step 4: Fundable List
- Projects meeting cut-off placed on list
- Goal: Execute agreements by June 30

## Take Action

1. **Review the CWSRF program** -- Visit the [CWSRF](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/srf/) page for an overview of eligible projects, financial terms, and current funding priorities.
2. **Read the Intended Use Plan** -- Download the [CWSRF Intended Use Plan (PDF)](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/srf/docs/2025/cwsrf-iup-sfy2025-26-final.pdf) to understand scoring criteria and the fundable list cut-off for FY 2025-26.
3. **Apply through FAAST** -- Submit your application at the [FAAST Portal](https://faast.waterboards.ca.gov) with technical documentation, financial information, and environmental compliance materials.
4. **Contact Financial Assistance** -- Call (916) 341-5700 to discuss your project's eligibility, scoring potential, and application preparation.
